text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a few short ribs braised with
wild porcini mushrooms and tomato and no
we're not going to go have to find wild
porcini mushrooms they come dry and very
easy to use and here they are really
packed with flavor once you soak them
and reconstitute them so I have about
1/2 a cup of porcini mushroom with about
a half a cup of water just let that sit
for about an hour I'm going to take my
beef short ribs I've got 8 nice big
thick beef short ribs it's about 2 and
1/2 pounds all right make sure you
season those really well on both sides
salt and pepper and in a heavy skillet
and a little bit of vegetable oil on
medium high heat you want to get a
really really nice sear ok so take your
time make sure you're broadening all
sides and then what we're going to do is
we're going to transfer those into a
Dutch oven braise them we're also going
to need an onion sliced and 3 or 4
cloves of garlic I'm going to dice up my
mushrooms which are nice and soft now
because they soaked ok and make sure you
reserve that liquid so they're going to
transfer my beef into my Dutch oven and
it has to look like that if it doesn't
look like that you didn't do it right
and that stuff at the bottom of the pan
is called the Fond that's what's going
to build all the flavor here for our
sauce and our braising liquid you know
that saying you can't fake the funk you
can fake funk I have fake funk many
times you can't fake the Fond all right
so if you don't have that caramelized
brown stuff at the bottom of the pan
this next step is not going to be as
good so we're throwing our onions with a
pinch of salt and we're going to soften
those for about 3 minutes and the juices
from the onions are going to kind of
start deglazing the bottom I'm going to
throw in my garlic give that another
minute all right we're going to throw
the mushrooms in there give that a quick
stir and then we're going to deglaze now
when you soak mushrooms there is a small
chance it will be a little bit of grit
or sand at the bottom of the container
that you soak them in so when you pour
in your mushroom liquid that half a cup
of water you soak them in don't pour it
all the way down to the bottom just pour
it in leave the last teaspoon in there
just in case there's any grit all right
we're going to stir that around you can
see that beautiful Fond that brownness
is now dissolving into the sauce
all right couple cups of my beef broth
some dry rosemary I'm going to put in a
cup of a tomato sauce pretty much any
tomato product will work here except you
know something bizarre like salsa about
half a teaspoon of salt some cayenne and
a bay leaf now we're going to adjust for
salt later the meathead salt on it so
we're just going to give it a half a
teaspoon for now and we'll taste later
all right we're going to pour the liquid
in we're going to cover that tightly
this is a seven and a half I believe
quart Dutch oven and we're going to
braise that for two hours at 325 until
they look amazing and they're
fork-tender see the fork goes right in
the bones will be falling off and that's
it we're going to pull that out of there
now I like to leave this overnight so I
can pull the fat off the top of the
sauce and it's almost like they're
better the next day but if you want to
eat this right away
make sure you tilt the pan a little bit
and just skim that oil off the top that
beef fat off the top you don't need that
it's got enough flavor and there it is
fork-tender amazing Beaufort ribs that
braising liquid has been just
beautifully perfumed with the wild
porcini mushrooms earthy but not too
overpowering the tomato just makes a
really nice gravy over some mashed
potatoes its traditional and that is one
fantastic fall winter or you know at any
time meal so I hope you give that a try
all the ingredients are out of sight and
as always enjoy
